summary: Me in almost every other Pokemon game: I cannot get anywhere without either using Fly or a bicycle. Even running feels way too...
body:
Me in almost every other Pokemon game: I cannot get anywhere without either using Fly or a bicycle. Even running feels way too slow.

Me in a Pokemon game which has a Pokemon follow you: I will walk 500 miles and I will walk 500 more so that my Pikachu doesn’t have to go back in its Poke Ball.

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Ampdra, Gaspharos, Gootrodon and Gasdraros Types: Ampdra - Dragon/Electric, Gaspharos - Electric/Water, Gootrodon -...
caption:
Ampdra, Gaspharos, Gootrodon and Gasdraros

Types: Ampdra - Dragon/Electric, Gaspharos - Electric/Water, Gootrodon - Dragon/Water, Gasdraros - Dragon

Abilities: Ampdra - Volt Absorb, Gaspharos - Storm Drain, Gootrodon - Gooey, Gasdraros - Paralysing Liquid - Water Type moves have a 30% chance to paralyse the opponent

Stats: Ampdra: HP - 100, Atk - 85, Def - 80 SpA - 120, SpD - 135, Spe - 75, Gaspharos: HP - 110, Atk - 85, Def - 75, SpA - 115, SpD - 95, Spe - 60, Gootrodon: HP - 115, Atk - 93, Def - 75, SpA - 110, SpD - 120, Spe - 70, Gasdraros: HP - 120, Atk - 97, Def - 90, SpA - 125, SpD - 140, Spe - 80

Ampdra - The Current Control Pokemon, Gaspharos - The Electric Sea Slug Pokemon, Gootrodon - The Swamp Dragon Pokemon, Gasdraros - The Electrified Water Pokemon

Ampdra is used to control current when a problem may arise. Electricity zaps between its two horns on its head.

Gaspharos lives in the sea and shoots a small bolt of electricity at opponents who come into contact with it. It lives on the deep ocean floor and attracts its prey by lighting its body up. 

Gootrodon lives in swamps and hides itself in the murky water. The fin on its back lights up to confuse its prey and then it will attack them.

Gasdrados uses the power of water and electricity. It will electrify its water powers to try and paralyse its prey. Its body lights up to distract its opponent whilst it charges up its power. The light on its tail is also used as a method to distract its prey. 

Request for @houndoom-kaboom. I hope you like it! Fusing my three favourite boys!

blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Mega Evolution Retrospective
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Mega Evolution Retrospective
body:
Indeed, before we hit up Gen 6 itself, we’re gonna touch upon the generation’s “gimmick.” A mini retrospective-style review! Just decided we may as well get this out of the way, since there’s only two Mega evolutions we haven’t touched, belonging to Diancie and Necrozma (Ultra Necrozma being very functionally similar to a Mega).

Gen 6 is gonna be a peculiar beast. To date, it’s the shortest generation, having only 72 new Pokemon, but decidedly making up for that lost number by giving 50 previous Pokemon these new Mega Evolutions, as a temporary form change that increases their stats and gives them new abilities. And this direction to take was one I have mixed reaction to. It’s a sound idea, but Megas were often given to already pretty popular and/or pretty powerful Pokemon so only a handful of Pokemon actually in need of a power boost got one. It also winds up being a rather selfish mechanic, given only a handful of Pokemon could get one. And if your favorite just happens to not be the sort of Pokemon Gamefreak expect your favorite to be, then that’s just too bad.

Admittedly, I wasn’t keen on the idea at first. Maybe because none of the Mega forms they first showed off were particularly good at selling the idea to me. I did significantly warm up to the idea when they revealed Mega Kangaskhan. Now, I’ve grown to like a few of them. Outright dislike others. The whole Mega Evolutions roster is a mixed bag. Some of them build off of their base form nicely, while others either do nothing for the Pokemon in question or just turn them into an overdesigned mess. Which is pretty bad on Pokemon that already straddle that line pretty hard like Rayquaza or Garchomp.

And interestingly enough, now through Gen 7, we’ve gotten no new Mega Evolutions. Apart from, of course, Ultra Necrozma, but it’s kinda up in the air of they consider that an official “Mega” even if Ultra Necrozma is functionally very much the same thing. Does this mean Megas won’t be a recurring thing, just a one-and-done feature for X and Y? It’s sounding likely. But they also probably wanted to make way for the Z-Move feature, Alolan Forms, and Ultra Beasts. But with how much X and Y were forcefully involved with Sun and Moon, you’d think Mega Evolution would play a part in it. I wouldn’t say no to new Megas in Gen 8, especially since we also seem to be done with Legacy Evolutions too. And there’s still plenty of Pokemon that could use a much-needed boost in power.

I am glad I decided to cover them in the way I did. They aren’t as absolutely vital to Kalos’s flavor as much as Alolan Forms are to Alola. But also they would be meaning I’d have to do a lot of redraws back to back to back for some of these. PLUS, that’d be around 38 individual reviews, even if I lumped related Megas together into one. Nah, I’d like the hypothetical Mega Block to be done within a month, thank you very much.

But, let’s go ahead and do a list breakdown of these things!

Top 10 Favorite Megas:

It might be cheating since these Megas are Megas of Pokemon I already liked a lot. But still, a very fun and cool bunch! I’m still thoroughly happy Sceptile’s didn’t get butchered. That handful of Megas that boosted a Pokemon’s cool-factor without going overboard is really nice.

Bottom 10 Least Favorite Megas:

Or at least, the latter four might just be the Megas I feel add the least to their previous forms. Gallade is still Gallade, Steelix is a jumbled confused mess, Latios and Latias are clones now more than ever, and Meditite just. Doesn’t look good. The rest just end up looking real doofy in how hard they tried to make them look cool.

The Most Creative Ones:

I wish there were more Megas like these fellas. Yeah, let it say something about the creative effort of the Megas when “has wings now” is on this list.

Most Deserved:

This group right here also probably get the best out of getting a boost in power level. They needed a stat boost to keep up, and by george they got one. Kangaskhan even became notorious for being one of the most broken Megas in the game for its abuse of getting to use Power-Up Punch twice in one turn.

Least Deserved:

Not gonna count Legendaries, since they tend to get special treatment anyway that a few were bound to get Megas. But aren’t these Pokemon either A. Already stupidly powerful enough, so giving them a Mega form only makes them even more busted? Or B. Already super popular, thus are hogging limelight that could be given to some old-forgottens some much-needed love.

Or they’re both!

Pokemon I’m Surprised DIDN’T Get Megas:

You’d think for this big Mega Evolution push they would’ve gotten their mascot on board for it, but nope, actually!

These two are beloved classics, I’m surprised they didn’t receive Megas for their popularity among Gen 1 fans alone. Let alone Nidoking for being the first game’s big bad’s signature Pokemon.

Given how Alakazam and Gengar got Mega forms, I’m surprised they left out poor Machamp. Felt like they were a bit of an unofficial trifecta of Pokemon of three stages and using the trading mechanic to evolve. I won’t lose sleep over it of course, but. Who knows, maybe it was considered but they couldn’t settle on a design.

Again, Lapras feels like both one of Gen 1’s flagship Pokemon while also being a little less known than say, Charizard or Mewtwo. Seemed like a perfect Mega Evolution candidate.

[Literally any of the Eeveelutions]

If only in the fact that Gamefreak surely must’ve thought this would’ve printed so much money.

I’m far from alone on this. One of Gen 3’s most popular Pokemon, and being Dragon that’s sadly far outclassed by most others. It’s painful being a fan of Flygon and seeing no Megas come out of XY. But then ORAS reveals there’s more Megas to come! But STILL no dice. It was even outright said there was going to be a Mega Flygon but they couldn’t settle on one design. Which is CRIMES. You’ve thrown more than one Mega at a Pokemon before, Gamefreak! Just give Flygon an X and Y mega! One for it being the expected route where it remains a Dragon/Ground type, and the COOL ONE that becomes more insectoid and becomes the Dragon/BUG TYPE IT WAS MEANT TO BE.

CRIMES.

I’ll elaborate further later, but again. One of Gen 3’s most popular monsters. No Mega! It seems so bizarre that a good chunk of the ORAS Mega expansion had so many Megas that aren’t even Pokemon that live in Hoenn and yet Hoenn fandom faves like Flygon and Milotic get left out. And for what, Mega Steelix?

Solely since Glalie got one. Poor Froslass got left out in the cold on that deal.

If they clearly weren’t very concerned about giving already powerful Pokemon even more power just because they were popular, why not Excadrill? You’d pretty much be making fun of the fact that people care at that point.

Now, I know X and Y gave you a second set of Starters to choose from; picking one of the Kanto starters so you could use their Mega form later on. But still, you would’ve thought the Gen to create Mega Evolution would have more Mega Evolution in it. This goes for the whole of Gen 6 too! No Megas aside from Diancie! What’s up with that? It feels like these three at LEAST should have Megas as something that would’ve set them apart from the other starters in that they’re the flagship trio for Megas.

I feel like this is mostly up to the expectation that there would’ve been a “Pokemon Z.” I even had dreams they unveiled Pokemon Z, not with Zygarde, but with a Mega Xerneas and Mega Yveltal. But since we never go that, this dream never came to fruition.

15 Dream Megas:

I can still hold out hope that Megas aren’t done for, and that one day we may receive these Pokemon as Mega forms:

(Do keep in mind I know next to nothing about the Pokemon metagame. So if I suggest something completely broken, I’m just listing off some Pokemon I wish got Megas solely out of a love for design sort of thing.)

Completely and totally selfish here, I know. But I wanna imagine for a second a Mega Zoroark that goes absolutely nuts with the hair and kabuki dancer theme, complete with mask-like markings over its face. Another thing is that Zoroark is sadly not very viable in battle. Because you get to see your opponent’s team before a battle ingame anyway, Zoroark loses almost all of its surprise factor since it’ll cast next to no one off guard so long as they know Zoroark is on their opponent’s team. So why not my Mega Zoroark a burst-damage attacker that deals a significant amount of damage as its first move busting out of its vanilla form’s illusion.

To this day, it’s still an absolute crime that Magnezone cannot acquire Levitate. So we could finally deliver a Mega Form that does just that! Not only that, but also there are some interesting things you could do with Magnezone. It’s already based on the traditional UFO shape, so why not take the magnets it’s attached to and turn thin into whole wings and/or “guns.” While the other two Magnemites finally break free but orbit around the main body as options. You got yourself a Gradius Pokemon before Vikavolt existed!

Also, I’ve drawn a few Megas of my own before. So now’s the perfect opportunity to shamelessly show them off.

A hypothetical Mega Milotic would admittedly be a pretty basic upgrade kind of Mega. But I’d still like to imagine a Mega Milotic where its tail end becomes all colorful and stained glass-like, with crazy flowing “hair.” Just throwing the whole beauty aspect higher and higher there.

It comes to no surprise that Shedinja for me easily might be one of the single most clever designs in the entire series. But it’s with great grief I must admit… actually using one is a pain in the ass. A single hit-point, plenty of weaknesses, and no immunity to non-attack forms of damage. So harsh weather could sneeze on the thing and it’ll keel over. And sadly, given the Mega Evolution rule, no Mega Evolution gets an upgrade to its HP probably due to some programming issues of increasing the thing’s max HP mid-fight. But something I may propose is the shell falling onto the ground, while the Mega-Evolved soul of Shedinja arises from the thing’s back. Its MAX HP increased, but its HP is still at 1. So it uses a new ability that gives turns all moves into HP-suckers like Leech Life or the like so that it can eat some HP back up. Either that, or keep its HP at one, ditch its pointless Defense stats in favor of super-boosting its Attack, Special Attack, and Speed. Becoming the glassiest cannoniest thing that ever was.

Vanilluxe has so many potential Mega-Evolution ideas that I would’ve said screw it and gave it an X and Y. Think of all the inspiration you could draw from popular ice cream flavors, like becoming an Ice/Fire Hot Fudge monster! Or a Ice/Rock Rocky Road monster! Or growing a third head and becoming Neapolitan! The only bum thing about giving it a secondary typing is that its moveset isn’t very diverse, so maybe you’d have to shoe-horn in letting it be able to learn Lava Plume or Power Gem somewhere in there to give it a decent STAB move. Even if it would otherwise be out of place.

This almost made it up there in the “Was Surprised it Didn’t Get a Mega” segment, but Vespiquen also isn’t A. From Gen 1, or B. All that Popular to begin with. Sadly, Vespiquen’s been plagued with the disadvantage of being assigned a more defensive role with a terrible, TERRIBLE defensive typing in Bug/Flying. If you didn’t want to just convert it into an attacker from Mega Evolving, you could boost its Defenses and give it a new Bug/Steel typing. Wouldn’t be too out of place for a Pokemon of royalty! And it still has a fair weak spot in getting wrecked by Fire types. And if you felt so inclined, you could trade out Pressure for Levitate. Or…

Pull a semi-Mega Kangaskhan and let it feel like an actual queen with bee drones at her disposal! The two “royal guard” combee could act as essentially a free Substitute upon Mega Evolving, or is like Mimikyu’s Disguise ability where the guards will eat up one attack per battle.

While Porygon-Z is a definitely a favorite, I’d say this one would be quite deserved given that darn Eviolite item’s goofiness. Because now Porygon 2 is actually more competitively viable than Porygon-Z is. Which may be the way Silph Co liked it, but Porygon-Z’s got plenty of Mega potential as a glitch-monster. It could just go absolutely bonkers and look absolutely broken and reality-bending, with its stability only becoming worse. Alternatively, you could throw a double-whammey in there and also give Porygon 2 a Mega to be a stand-out NFE Mega. It’d also make sense for Silph Co to develop a Mega Porygon 2 that would be completely inaccessible for people that illegally evolved their Porygon 2, but then an even more illegal Porgon-Z Mega pops up so they could Mega Evolve their Porygon-Zs.

Again, might’ve been in the “Surprised No Mega” group, but I can understand that Unown’s more of a Pokemon with a collection gimmick than an actual attempt at making it competitively viable. But I still think there’s some missed potential in allowing a sole Unown be able to call upon a whole swarm of alphabet soup like its often shown doing in the anime and games. And while it still only has Hidden Power, it could have an ability where its attacks gain additional effects based on which letter that Mega-Evolved, or is the core of the swarm. A could lower the target’s Attack or something, P applying Paralysis, Z giving its Hidden Power more finishing power, doing more damage the lower the opponent’s HP is.

A common suggestion for a lesser Pokemon to get a Mega. But so many wanna turn Dunsparce into a badass and I can only say NO. If I were to make a Mega Dunsparce, I’d be down with giving it a relatively unchanged design, maybe some touch-ups like a bigger drill-tail or being generally longer. But allow the thing’s nubby little wings to become full-on angelic and giant. Just this dopey little fat snake flying around on huge wings. I do approve of the consensus of giving it a Dragon type though. We need quirkier Dragons.

If nothing else, for having the phrase “Mega Yanmega” being uttered ingame mid-battle as if you oughta take this situation seriously. But for real, Yanmega’s so badass as is, I’d take a simple self-indulgent Mega that just makes it even cooler, even buggier, even more lizard-like. And it WILL be Bug/Dragon you ABSOLUTE COWARDS.

Like I said in my review of the thing, poor guy got side-lined pretty hard. Even in its own Generation, Druddigon is outclassed by nearly every Dragon in the game. Screw Salamence and Garchomp, it’s THIS fella that needs a Mega! And it can fully realize its Gargoyley ways! Dragon/Rock type and everything. Even with already learning a couple Rock moves, inserting more wouldn’t be that thematically weird!

It’s just such a shame a cool Pokemon like Skarmory just falls harder and harder into irrelevancy and forgotteness. A problem a shiny new Mega would fix, even. Plus, with Skarmory already having a big of a “helmet” on, I could easily see adding on a bit of a knightly theme to it working out quite well. Its even already got some sword-like wings. AND AND it’s thematic given this gen takes place in Europe as well!

Gen 5 just needs more Megas in general, my dude! And above all, Garbodor needs a Mega more than most, since it could use the stat boost and the change in typing to give it more realized bulk. Easy enough to give the thing torn shreds of a trash can or dumpster to use as armor and give it a Poison/Steel typing! As for an ability, you could give it something that tends to its Garbage-eating ways! When it makes physical contact with its target, it could steal the opponent’s item and just eat it. OR. Once sent out into battle, instead of taking damage from Spikes or Stealth Rock, it EATS the Spikes and Stealth Rocks! And Toxic Spikes too of course. He’s the trash man that just comes out and eats all the garbage.

Technically cheating here, but  I feel like if one were to get a Mega, the other would have to as well. And again, perhaps some spoilers on my high opinion on these two, but given they’re Halloweenyness, I can’t imagine the fact that I love these two is much of a surprise. But still, anything that would make Trevenant a bulky, frankentree maybe with even more faces on it. A vengeful tree spirit! And Gourgeist, while remaining Grass/Ghost, could pick up more Fire type traits like a burning candle-head, and more emphasis on its belly-mouth. Spooky!

And… here’s a vote solely for a Pokemon down on its luck. So forgotten, Farfetch’d is often requested to receive a Mega but Dewgong is left behind in that hype department. And I really do wanna like Dewgong! You could give it a Mega with more graceful features, taking its flowey fin parts and making it look more dress-like and fancy. Admittedly, that’s all I got. Dewgong’s not got a lot to work with, sadly.

But at any rate, for real this time. Next Friday, we’re moving onto Gen 6!

[Archive]

If nothing else, for having the phrase “Mega Yanmega” being uttered ingame mid-battle as if you oughta take this situation seriously. But for real, Yanmega’s so badass as is, I’d take a simple self-indulgent Mega that just makes it even cooler, even buggier, even more lizard-like. And it WILL be Bug/Dragon you ABSOLUTE COWARDS.

Like I said in my review of the thing, poor guy got side-lined pretty hard. Even in its own Generation, Druddigon is outclassed by nearly every Dragon in the game. Screw Salamence and Garchomp, it’s THIS fella that needs a Mega! And it can fully realize its Gargoyley ways! Dragon/Rock type and everything. Even with already learning a couple Rock moves, inserting more wouldn’t be that thematically weird!

It’s just such a shame a cool Pokemon like Skarmory just falls harder and harder into irrelevancy and forgotteness. A problem a shiny new Mega would fix, even. Plus, with Skarmory already having a big of a “helmet” on, I could easily see adding on a bit of a knightly theme to it working out quite well. Its even already got some sword-like wings. AND AND it’s thematic given this gen takes place in Europe as well!

Gen 5 just needs more Megas in general, my dude! And above all, Garbodor needs a Mega more than most, since it could use the stat boost and the change in typing to give it more realized bulk. Easy enough to give the thing torn shreds of a trash can or dumpster to use as armor and give it a Poison/Steel typing! As for an ability, you could give it something that tends to its Garbage-eating ways! When it makes physical contact with its target, it could steal the opponent’s item and just eat it. OR. Once sent out into battle, instead of taking damage from Spikes or Stealth Rock, it EATS the Spikes and Stealth Rocks! And Toxic Spikes too of course. He’s the trash man that just comes out and eats all the garbage.

Technically cheating here, but  I feel like if one were to get a Mega, the other would have to as well. And again, perhaps some spoilers on my high opinion on these two, but given they’re Halloweenyness, I can’t imagine the fact that I love these two is much of a surprise. But still, anything that would make Trevenant a bulky, frankentree maybe with even more faces on it. A vengeful tree spirit! And Gourgeist, while remaining Grass/Ghost, could pick up more Fire type traits like a burning candle-head, and more emphasis on its belly-mouth. Spooky!

And… here’s a vote solely for a Pokemon down on its luck. So forgotten, Farfetch’d is often requested to receive a Mega but Dewgong is left behind in that hype department. And I really do wanna like Dewgong! You could give it a Mega with more graceful features, taking its flowey fin parts and making it look more dress-like and fancy. Admittedly, that’s all I got. Dewgong’s not got a lot to work with, sadly.

But at any rate, for real this time. Next Friday, we’re moving onto Gen 6!

trail.content_raw:
[[MORE]]

Indeed, before we hit up Gen 6 itself, we’re gonna touch upon the generation’s “gimmick.” A mini retrospective-style review! Just decided we may as well get this out of the way, since there’s only two Mega evolutions we haven’t touched, belonging to Diancie and Necrozma (Ultra Necrozma being very functionally similar to a Mega).

Gen 6 is gonna be a peculiar beast. To date, it’s the shortest generation, having only 72 new Pokemon, but decidedly making up for that lost number by giving 50 previous Pokemon these new Mega Evolutions, as a temporary form change that increases their stats and gives them new abilities. And this direction to take was one I have mixed reaction to. It’s a sound idea, but Megas were often given to already pretty popular and/or pretty powerful Pokemon so only a handful of Pokemon actually in need of a power boost got one. It also winds up being a rather selfish mechanic, given only a handful of Pokemon could get one. And if your favorite just happens to not be the sort of Pokemon Gamefreak expect your favorite to be, then that’s just too bad.

Admittedly, I wasn’t keen on the idea at first. Maybe because none of the Mega forms they first showed off were particularly good at selling the idea to me. I did significantly warm up to the idea when they revealed Mega Kangaskhan. Now, I’ve grown to like a few of them. Outright dislike others. The whole Mega Evolutions roster is a mixed bag. Some of them build off of their base form nicely, while others either do nothing for the Pokemon in question or just turn them into an overdesigned mess. Which is pretty bad on Pokemon that already straddle that line pretty hard like Rayquaza or Garchomp.

And interestingly enough, now through Gen 7, we’ve gotten no new Mega Evolutions. Apart from, of course, Ultra Necrozma, but it’s kinda up in the air of they consider that an official “Mega” even if Ultra Necrozma is functionally very much the same thing. Does this mean Megas won’t be a recurring thing, just a one-and-done feature for X and Y? It’s sounding likely. But they also probably wanted to make way for the Z-Move feature, Alolan Forms, and Ultra Beasts. But with how much X and Y were forcefully involved with Sun and Moon, you’d think Mega Evolution would play a part in it. I wouldn’t say no to new Megas in Gen 8, especially since we also seem to be done with Legacy Evolutions too. And there’s still plenty of Pokemon that could use a much-needed boost in power.

I am glad I decided to cover them in the way I did. They aren’t as absolutely vital to Kalos’s flavor as much as Alolan Forms are to Alola. But also they would be meaning I’d have to do a lot of redraws back to back to back for some of these. PLUS, that’d be around 38 individual reviews, even if I lumped related Megas together into one. Nah, I’d like the hypothetical Mega Block to be done within a month, thank you very much.

But, let’s go ahead and do a list breakdown of these things!

Top 10 Favorite Megas:

It might be cheating since these Megas are Megas of Pokemon I already liked a lot. But still, a very fun and cool bunch! I’m still thoroughly happy Sceptile’s didn’t get butchered. That handful of Megas that boosted a Pokemon’s cool-factor without going overboard is really nice.

Bottom 10 Least Favorite Megas:

Or at least, the latter four might just be the Megas I feel add the least to their previous forms. Gallade is still Gallade, Steelix is a jumbled confused mess, Latios and Latias are clones now more than ever, and Meditite just. Doesn’t look good. The rest just end up looking real doofy in how hard they tried to make them look cool.

The Most Creative Ones:

I wish there were more Megas like these fellas. Yeah, let it say something about the creative effort of the Megas when “has wings now” is on this list.

Most Deserved:

This group right here also probably get the best out of getting a boost in power level. They needed a stat boost to keep up, and by george they got one. Kangaskhan even became notorious for being one of the most broken Megas in the game for its abuse of getting to use Power-Up Punch twice in one turn.

Least Deserved:

Not gonna count Legendaries, since they tend to get special treatment anyway that a few were bound to get Megas. But aren’t these Pokemon either A. Already stupidly powerful enough, so giving them a Mega form only makes them even more busted? Or B. Already super popular, thus are hogging limelight that could be given to some old-forgottens some much-needed love.

Or they’re both!

Pokemon I’m Surprised DIDN’T Get Megas:

You’d think for this big Mega Evolution push they would’ve gotten their mascot on board for it, but nope, actually!

These two are beloved classics, I’m surprised they didn’t receive Megas for their popularity among Gen 1 fans alone. Let alone Nidoking for being the first game’s big bad’s signature Pokemon.

Given how Alakazam and Gengar got Mega forms, I’m surprised they left out poor Machamp. Felt like they were a bit of an unofficial trifecta of Pokemon of three stages and using the trading mechanic to evolve. I won’t lose sleep over it of course, but. Who knows, maybe it was considered but they couldn’t settle on a design.

Again, Lapras feels like both one of Gen 1’s flagship Pokemon while also being a little less known than say, Charizard or Mewtwo. Seemed like a perfect Mega Evolution candidate.

[Literally any of the Eeveelutions]

If only in the fact that Gamefreak surely must’ve thought this would’ve printed so much money.

I’m far from alone on this. One of Gen 3’s most popular Pokemon, and being Dragon that’s sadly far outclassed by most others. It’s painful being a fan of Flygon and seeing no Megas come out of XY. But then ORAS reveals there’s more Megas to come! But STILL no dice. It was even outright said there was going to be a Mega Flygon but they couldn’t settle on one design. Which is CRIMES. You’ve thrown more than one Mega at a Pokemon before, Gamefreak! Just give Flygon an X and Y mega! One for it being the expected route where it remains a Dragon/Ground type, and the COOL ONE that becomes more insectoid and becomes the Dragon/BUG TYPE IT WAS MEANT TO BE.

CRIMES.

I’ll elaborate further later, but again. One of Gen 3’s most popular monsters. No Mega! It seems so bizarre that a good chunk of the ORAS Mega expansion had so many Megas that aren’t even Pokemon that live in Hoenn and yet Hoenn fandom faves like Flygon and Milotic get left out. And for what, Mega Steelix?

Solely since Glalie got one. Poor Froslass got left out in the cold on that deal.

If they clearly weren’t very concerned about giving already powerful Pokemon even more power just because they were popular, why not Excadrill? You’d pretty much be making fun of the fact that people care at that point.

Now, I know X and Y gave you a second set of Starters to choose from; picking one of the Kanto starters so you could use their Mega form later on. But still, you would’ve thought the Gen to create Mega Evolution would have more Mega Evolution in it. This goes for the whole of Gen 6 too! No Megas aside from Diancie! What’s up with that? It feels like these three at LEAST should have Megas as something that would’ve set them apart from the other starters in that they’re the flagship trio for Megas.

I feel like this is mostly up to the expectation that there would’ve been a “Pokemon Z.” I even had dreams they unveiled Pokemon Z, not with Zygarde, but with a Mega Xerneas and Mega Yveltal. But since we never go that, this dream never came to fruition.

15 Dream Megas:

I can still hold out hope that Megas aren’t done for, and that one day we may receive these Pokemon as Mega forms:

(Do keep in mind I know next to nothing about the Pokemon metagame. So if I suggest something completely broken, I’m just listing off some Pokemon I wish got Megas solely out of a love for design sort of thing.)

Completely and totally selfish here, I know. But I wanna imagine for a second a Mega Zoroark that goes absolutely nuts with the hair and kabuki dancer theme, complete with mask-like markings over its face. Another thing is that Zoroark is sadly not very viable in battle. Because you get to see your opponent’s team before a battle ingame anyway, Zoroark loses almost all of its surprise factor since it’ll cast next to no one off guard so long as they know Zoroark is on their opponent’s team. So why not my Mega Zoroark a burst-damage attacker that deals a significant amount of damage as its first move busting out of its vanilla form’s illusion.

To this day, it’s still an absolute crime that Magnezone cannot acquire Levitate. So we could finally deliver a Mega Form that does just that! Not only that, but also there are some interesting things you could do with Magnezone. It’s already based on the traditional UFO shape, so why not take the magnets it’s attached to and turn thin into whole wings and/or “guns.” While the other two Magnemites finally break free but orbit around the main body as options. You got yourself a Gradius Pokemon before Vikavolt existed!

Also, I’ve drawn a few Megas of my own before. So now’s the perfect opportunity to shamelessly show them off.

A hypothetical Mega Milotic would admittedly be a pretty basic upgrade kind of Mega. But I’d still like to imagine a Mega Milotic where its tail end becomes all colorful and stained glass-like, with crazy flowing “hair.” Just throwing the whole beauty aspect higher and higher there.

It comes to no surprise that Shedinja for me easily might be one of the single most clever designs in the entire series. But it’s with great grief I must admit… actually using one is a pain in the ass. A single hit-point, plenty of weaknesses, and no immunity to non-attack forms of damage. So harsh weather could sneeze on the thing and it’ll keel over. And sadly, given the Mega Evolution rule, no Mega Evolution gets an upgrade to its HP probably due to some programming issues of increasing the thing’s max HP mid-fight. But something I may propose is the shell falling onto the ground, while the Mega-Evolved soul of Shedinja arises from the thing’s back. Its MAX HP increased, but its HP is still at 1. So it uses a new ability that gives turns all moves into HP-suckers like Leech Life or the like so that it can eat some HP back up. Either that, or keep its HP at one, ditch its pointless Defense stats in favor of super-boosting its Attack, Special Attack, and Speed. Becoming the glassiest cannoniest thing that ever was.

Vanilluxe has so many potential Mega-Evolution ideas that I would’ve said screw it and gave it an X and Y. Think of all the inspiration you could draw from popular ice cream flavors, like becoming an Ice/Fire Hot Fudge monster! Or a Ice/Rock Rocky Road monster! Or growing a third head and becoming Neapolitan! The only bum thing about giving it a secondary typing is that its moveset isn’t very diverse, so maybe you’d have to shoe-horn in letting it be able to learn Lava Plume or Power Gem somewhere in there to give it a decent STAB move. Even if it would otherwise be out of place.

This almost made it up there in the “Was Surprised it Didn’t Get a Mega” segment, but Vespiquen also isn’t A. From Gen 1, or B. All that Popular to begin with. Sadly, Vespiquen’s been plagued with the disadvantage of being assigned a more defensive role with a terrible, TERRIBLE defensive typing in Bug/Flying. If you didn’t want to just convert it into an attacker from Mega Evolving, you could boost its Defenses and give it a new Bug/Steel typing. Wouldn’t be too out of place for a Pokemon of royalty! And it still has a fair weak spot in getting wrecked by Fire types. And if you felt so inclined, you could trade out Pressure for Levitate. Or…

Pull a semi-Mega Kangaskhan and let it feel like an actual queen with bee drones at her disposal! The two “royal guard” combee could act as essentially a free Substitute upon Mega Evolving, or is like Mimikyu’s Disguise ability where the guards will eat up one attack per battle.

While Porygon-Z is a definitely a favorite, I’d say this one would be quite deserved given that darn Eviolite item’s goofiness. Because now Porygon 2 is actually more competitively viable than Porygon-Z is. Which may be the way Silph Co liked it, but Porygon-Z’s got plenty of Mega potential as a glitch-monster. It could just go absolutely bonkers and look absolutely broken and reality-bending, with its stability only becoming worse. Alternatively, you could throw a double-whammey in there and also give Porygon 2 a Mega to be a stand-out NFE Mega. It’d also make sense for Silph Co to develop a Mega Porygon 2 that would be completely inaccessible for people that illegally evolved their Porygon 2, but then an even more illegal Porgon-Z Mega pops up so they could Mega Evolve their Porygon-Zs.

Again, might’ve been in the “Surprised No Mega” group, but I can understand that Unown’s more of a Pokemon with a collection gimmick than an actual attempt at making it competitively viable. But I still think there’s some missed potential in allowing a sole Unown be able to call upon a whole swarm of alphabet soup like its often shown doing in the anime and games. And while it still only has Hidden Power, it could have an ability where its attacks gain additional effects based on which letter that Mega-Evolved, or is the core of the swarm. A could lower the target’s Attack or something, P applying Paralysis, Z giving its Hidden Power more finishing power, doing more damage the lower the opponent’s HP is.

A common suggestion for a lesser Pokemon to get a Mega. But so many wanna turn Dunsparce into a badass and I can only say NO. If I were to make a Mega Dunsparce, I’d be down with giving it a relatively unchanged design, maybe some touch-ups like a bigger drill-tail or being generally longer. But allow the thing’s nubby little wings to become full-on angelic and giant. Just this dopey little fat snake flying around on huge wings. I do approve of the consensus of giving it a Dragon type though. We need quirkier Dragons.

If nothing else, for having the phrase “Mega Yanmega” being uttered ingame mid-battle as if you oughta take this situation seriously. But for real, Yanmega’s so badass as is, I’d take a simple self-indulgent Mega that just makes it even cooler, even buggier, even more lizard-like. And it WILL be Bug/Dragon you ABSOLUTE COWARDS.

Plus, with Skarmory already having a big of a “helmet” on, I could easily see adding on a bit of a knightly theme to it working out quite well. Its even already got some sword-like wings. AND AND it’s thematic given this gen takes place in Europe as well!

Even if it would otherwise be out of place.

This almost made it up there in the “Was Surprised it Didn’t Get a Mega” segment, but Vespiquen also isn’t A. From Gen 1, or B. All that Popular to begin with. Sadly, Vespiquen’s been plagued with the disadvantage of being assigned a more defensive role with a terrible, TERRIBLE defensive typing in Bug/Flying. If you didn’t want to just convert it into an attacker from Mega Evolving, you could boost its Defenses and give it a new Bug/Steel typing. Wouldn’t be too out of place for a Pokemon of royalty! And it still has a fair weak spot in getting wrecked by Fire types. And if you felt so inclined, you could trade out Pressure for Levitate. Or…

Pull a semi-Mega Kangaskhan and let it feel like an actual queen with bee drones at her disposal! The two “royal guard” combee could act as essentially a free Substitute upon Mega Evolving, or is like Mimikyu’s Disguise ability where the guards will eat up one attack per battle.

While Porygon-Z is a definitely a favorite, I’d say this one would be quite deserved given that darn Eviolite item’s goofiness. Because now Porygon 2 is actually more competitively viable than Porygon-Z is. Which may be the way Silph Co liked it, but Porygon-Z’s got plenty of Mega potential as a glitch-monster. It could just go absolutely bonkers and look absolutely broken and reality-bending, with its stability only becoming worse. Alternatively, you could throw a double-whammey in there and also give Porygon 2 a Mega to be a stand-out NFE Mega. It’d also make sense for Silph Co to develop a Mega Porygon 2 that would be completely inaccessible for people that illegally evolved their Porygon 2, but then an even more illegal Porgon-Z Mega pops up so they could Mega Evolve their Porygon-Zs.

Again, might’ve been in the “Surprised No Mega” group, but I can understand that Unown’s more of a Pokemon with a collection gimmick than an actual attempt at making it competitively viable. But I still think there’s some missed potential in allowing a sole Unown be able to call upon a whole swarm of alphabet soup like its often shown doing in the anime and games. And while it still only has Hidden Power, it could have an ability where its attacks gain additional effects based on which letter that Mega-Evolved, or is the core of the swarm. A could lower the target’s Attack or something, P applying Paralysis, Z giving its Hidden Power more finishing power, doing more damage the lower the opponent’s HP is.

A common suggestion for a lesser Pokemon to get a Mega. But so many wanna turn Dunsparce into a badass and I can only say NO. If I were to make a Mega Dunsparce, I’d be down with giving it a relatively unchanged design, maybe some touch-ups like a bigger drill-tail or being generally longer. But allow the thing’s nubby little wings to become full-on angelic and giant. Just this dopey little fat snake flying around on huge wings. I do approve of the consensus of giving it a Dragon type though. We need quirkier Dragons.

If nothing else, for having the phrase “Mega Yanmega” being uttered ingame mid-battle as if you oughta take this situation seriously. But for real, Yanmega’s so badass as is, I’d take a simple self-indulgent Mega that just makes it even cooler, even buggier, even more lizard-like. And it WILL be Bug/Dragon you ABSOLUTE COWARDS.

Like I said in my review of the thing, poor guy got side-lined pretty hard. Even in its own Generation, Druddigon is outclassed by nearly every Dragon in the game. Screw Salamence and Garchomp, it’s THIS fella that needs a Mega! And it can fully realize its Gargoyley ways! Dragon/Rock type and everything. Even with already learning a couple Rock moves, inserting more wouldn’t be that thematically weird!

It’s just such a shame a cool Pokemon like Skarmory just falls harder and harder into irrelevancy and forgotteness. A problem a shiny new Mega would fix, even. Plus, with Skarmory already having a big of a “helmet” on, I could easily see adding on a bit of a knightly theme to it working out quite well. Its even already got some sword-like wings. AND AND it’s thematic given this gen takes place in Europe as well!

Gen 5 just needs more Megas in general, my dude! And above all, Garbodor needs a Mega more than most, since it could use the stat boost and the change in typing to give it more realized bulk. Easy enough to give the thing torn shreds of a trash can or dumpster to use as armor and give it a Poison/Steel typing! As for an ability, you could give it something that tends to its Garbage-eating ways! When it makes physical contact with its target, it could steal the opponent’s item and just eat it. OR. Once sent out into battle, instead of taking damage from Spikes or Stealth Rock, it EATS the Spikes and Stealth Rocks! And Toxic Spikes too of course. He’s the trash man that just comes out and eats all the garbage.

Technically cheating here, but  I feel like if one were to get a Mega, the other would have to as well. And again, perhaps some spoilers on my high opinion on these two, but given they’re Halloweenyness, I can’t imagine the fact that I love these two is much of a surprise. But still, anything that would make Trevenant a bulky, frankentree maybe with even more faces on it. A vengeful tree spirit! And Gourgeist, while remaining Grass/Ghost, could pick up more Fire type traits like a burning candle-head, and more emphasis on its belly-mouth. Spooky!

And… here’s a vote solely for a Pokemon down on its luck. So forgotten, Farfetch’d is often requested to receive a Mega but Dewgong is left behind in that hype department. And I really do wanna like Dewgong! You could give it a Mega with more graceful features, taking its flowey fin parts and making it look more dress-like and fancy. Admittedly, that’s all I got. Dewgong’s not got a lot to work with, sadly.

But at any rate, for real this time. Next Friday, we’re moving onto Gen 6!

[Archive]

summary: (9/19/18) The Pokémon marathon on Twitch is now LIVE! The next 13 episodes that is going to be streamed (from Season 4 Johto...
body:
(9/19/18) The Pokémon marathon on Twitch is now LIVE!

The next 13 episodes that is going to be streamed (from Season 4 Johto League Champions) today will feature an evil Teddiursa, Todd attempting to get a photo of Articuno, Brock getting really sick, Ash entering a Pokémon Sumo Competition, and much much more!

The episode set will rerun in multiple times today just so you won’t miss the stream depending on your schedule.

Watching with Twitch chat could be the best (or worst) experience you’ll ever have! But if you want a more comfy chat experience, feel free to talk/chat about the marathon in my Pokémon Discord server PokéTōku —> Invite link here :)

blog.description:
This is a random blog about randomness shit.
Art/Ask/RP/18+ blog/Multifandom
Post are mostly drawn and/or written.
There will be gore, dark themes, and cursing. But mostly just funny shit.
I draw video games, IRL stuff, random fandoms and NSFW, sometimes. Lots of stuff really.
Response is usually fast unless I'm doing something. Might have to wait for an hour or so. But if it's something big, like going to the hospital or a tragedy, I usually post about it after the event has passed or when it's less stressful.
Roleplay is private (NSFW and/or SFW). I RP mostly one liners to paragraphs. Genre is an open bag for me.
Also sorry for the bad art. I'm just using what I have and to the best of my ability.
Anonymous are allowed!
(Description may change randomly. Scatter brained a bit.)
Enjoy!

summary: Next sketchbook is named after another Nuzlocke pokemon. Dots the Azumarill is usually female for me. She has been used about...
body: Next sketchbook is named after another Nuzlocke pokemon. Dots the Azumarill is usually female for me. She has been used about two or three times during Nuzlocke playthroughs. I never thought I would like this water pokemon, but since it gains fairy typing and evolves early I guess it was worth it. Except Azurill. Wish they change the friendship needed to evolve to something else like an item.

title: Solrock - 338
body:
